title: The Panoptic sibyl system and the dystopia in gen urobuchis psycho pass
abstract: This thesis aims to prove that Sibyl System is the Panopticon and to analyze the causes of dystopia in Gen Urobuchi’s Psycho Pass. In Psycho Pass, Sibyl System is the governing system which is called the perfect system and it possesses a resemblance to the Panopticon. Because of this resemblance, Sibyl System may actually be a Panopticon and the writer wants to prove it using the theory of the Panopticon by Michel Foucault. Moreover, Sibyl System, as the governing system, shows signs of being the cause of the dystopian society in Psycho Pass even though it was designed for the purpose of creating utopia. To find out more about this, the writer analyzes each characteristic of the dystopian society and traces their causes to Sibyl System’s aspects. Through the analysis, by comparing Sibyl System’s aspects to six of the Panopticon’s aspects, it is found out that Sibyl System is indeed a Panopticon, and these panoptic aspects, like the royal menagerie function, with its loopholes are the causes of the dystopian society.
